sentence.content: BFN Dushanbe 16 May TASS -- The Tajik Communist Party has called for the restoration of a renovated Soviet Union in the form of a federation as the only means to ensure the development of the political, economic, and spiritual potential of former Soviet republics.

sentence.content: Tajik communists&apost; leader Shodiy Shabdolov told ITAR-TASS on Monday that the disintegration of the Soviet Union and the parade of sovereignty that followed it have led to economic and political chaos in all republics.

sentence.content: Radical market reforms "imposed by quasi- democrats" and "wild privatisation" have enriched a small group of nouveau riches and plunged the rest of the population in poverty and hunger, he said.

sentence.content: Over one million people, about two-thirds of the adult population, signed appeals "for unity, brotherhood and friendship of the peoples of the USSR" adopted by numerous conferences and meetings held all across the Republic.
